TunableTuple.name: gather_state
TunableTuple.description: The first state that the Sims will be put into when this Situation Starts.

TunableList.name: job_and_role_changes
TunableList.description: A mapping between situation jobs and role states that defines what role states we want to switch to for sims on which jobs when this situation state is entered.

Tunable.name: Role State
Tunable.description: The role state that we will switch sims of the linked job into.

Tunable.name: Situation Job
Tunable.description: A reference to a SituationJob that we will use to change sim's role state.

TunableVariant.name: time_out
TunableVariant.description: How long this state will last before time expired. Please talk to the GPE who implemented the specific situation to see what the state will do on time expired.

TunableTuple.name: member_job_and_role_states
TunableTuple.description: The jobs and roles that an org member will be used to fill in.

TunableList.name: org_member_jobs_and_roles
TunableList.mapping_value: Member Role State and Organization Info
TunableList.description: A mapping between a situation's jobs and default role states.

TunableTuple.name: Member Role State and Organization Info
TunableTuple.display: Member Role State And Organization Info

TunableVariant.description:
Additional filters to be applied to the members request.
If the existing members pool does not include sims that pass these filters, the org service will attempt to populate the list with more members that satisfy these filters.

TunableTuple.name: age
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their age. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value for the age. If you are looking for age variation, please choose "Age Variant" instead.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid age. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableEnum.name: ideal_value
TunableEnum.description: The ideal age of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

TunableEnum.name: max_value
TunableEnum.description: The maximum age of the sim we are filtering for.

TunableEnum.name: min_value
TunableEnum.description: The minimum age of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: age_progress
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their age progress. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by advancing their age progress, within the tuned bounds.

Tunable.name: ideal_value
Tunable.description: Ideal value of age progress.

Tunable.name: max_value
Tunable.description: Maximum value of age progress.

Tunable.name: min_value
Tunable.description: Minimum value of age progress.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: age_progress_percentage
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their age progress as a percentage. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value. Age progress values over 100% are capped at 100% for the purposes of evaluating a sim's age progress for this filter.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: ideal_value
Tunable.description: Ideal value of age progress as a percentage.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: value_range
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum age progress percentage.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: age_variant
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on a list of allowed ages.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid age. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableList.name: allowed_ages
TunableList.description: The allowed ages we're filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: can_age_up
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not age up at this time. Note: This probably does not do what you want it to do. It simply checks if the sim is not an elder and that aging is not disabled.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: can_be_outside
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not be outside. Restriction is implemented only for vampires. It needs to be updated if we add other occults or systems that resctrict it.
Normal Sim will always pass this filter. Certain Sim, e.g Vampire, cannot be outside on daytime except daywalker vampire.
New and existing Sims may be conformed to match this filter term by granting or removing vampire trait and daywalker perk.

Tunable.name: at_anytime
Tunable.description: If enabled, the Sim needs to be able to go outside during day and night. Otherwise, it needs to be able to go outside at current time or during certain period of time.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: career
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims in a specific career.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by granting them the career, provided any availability tests pass.

TunableVariant.name: career
TunableVariant.description: Define the career that this filter term applies to.

TunableTuple.name: from_category
TunableTuple.description: The filter term applies to the career, if any, of the specified category for the Sim.

TunableEnum.name: career_category
TunableEnum.description: The career category that this filter term applies to. Sims may be conformed if we want to remove the career, i.e. the term is inverted, but may not be conformed to join a career.

TunableTuple.name: from_explicit_type
TunableTuple.description: The filter term applies to a specific career.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career that this term applies to. Sims that are conformed to the filter will enter the career at its entry level.

TunableVariant.name: career_level
TunableVariant.description: If enabled we add an additional requirement of the user level of the career to the requirements.

TunableTuple.name: career_level_reference
TunableTuple.description: Filters sims based on a list of CareerLevel references.

TunableList.name: career_level_references
TunableList.description: A list of CareerLevels. One will be randomly chosen when conforming sims.

Tunable.description: A reference to a CareerLevel to join the career at. The CareerLevel must belong to the career tuned above.

TunableTuple.name: career_user_level
TunableTuple.description: Filters sims based on a user career level.

Tunable.name: career_user_level
Tunable.description: A user level. If this level cooresponds to an advanced branch and we conform or generate a sim with this filter and the career has branches a branch will be chosen at random. If this behavior is not desired, use Career Level Reference instead.

TunableVariant.name: career_location
TunableVariant.description: Define how important career location is for this filter. Leave None if location is not important.

TunableTuple.name: on_active_lot
TunableTuple.description: Any Sim must be in the specified career and hired by the venue on the active lot in order to match the filter. Sims that are conformed by joining a career will be hired by the venue on the active lot.

TunableVariant.name: career_schedule
TunableVariant.description: Define how scheduling affects this filter. Leave None if schedule is not important.

TunableTuple.name: available_now
TunableTuple.description: Any Sim must be in the specified career and must be scheduled to work at the time of the filter request. If they are not, their career will not be conformed to match the filter.

Tunable.name: career_seniority
Tunable.description: If enabled, Sims that have been in the career for longer will score higher than Sims that have been in the career for less time.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: cas_tags
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their CAS tags.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them with valid CAS tags. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableList.name: cas_tags
TunableList.description: Sims must have at least one of these tags on their parts for the filter to pass.

TunableVariant.name: creation_cas_tags
TunableVariant.description:
The tags to use when creating a new Sim with this filter term.
This should be same_as_cas_tags for almost all cases. Note that custom cas tags are supplied, the Sim must still have Cas Tags for sim creation to succeed.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: gender
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims base on their gender.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid gender. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableEnum.name: gender
TunableEnum.description: The required gender of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: gender_preference
TunableTuple.description: A filter term for filtering sims that fit the requesting sim info's gender preference.

Tunable.name: fallback_if_no_preference_is_set
Tunable.display: Fallback If No Preference Is Set
Tunable.description: If checked then if no gender preference is set then fallback.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: gender_relative
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims base on their gender relative to target sims gender.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid gender. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

Tunable.name: same
Tunable.description: If checked then we will make sure that the sim is the same gender as the target sim. Otherwise the opposite gender

TunableTuple.name: genealogy
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their genealogy.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by propagating genealogy relations.

TunableEnum.name: family_relationship
TunableEnum.description: This is the family relationship between the requesting sim and the target sim.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

Tunable.name: swap_direction
Tunable.description: This is the direction between the requesting sim and the target sim so that the genealogy is checked between the sim info and the requesting sim info.

TunableTuple.name: has_home_zone
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not have a home zone.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: include_vacation_home
Tunable.description: If enabled and the Sim is on a vacation at a zone, this will return True.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: has_household_ever_been_played
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not have ever been played by the user.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: household_composition
TunableTuple.description: A term for filtering Sims based on the composition of their household.

TunableVariant.name: age
TunableVariant.description: Define an age condition for Sims in the household.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their age. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value for the age. If you are looking for age variation, please choose "Age Variant" instead.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid age. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableEnum.name: ideal_value
TunableEnum.description: The ideal age of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

TunableEnum.name: max_value
TunableEnum.description: The maximum age of the sim we are filtering for.

TunableEnum.name: min_value
TunableEnum.description: The minimum age of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: Define a gender condition for Sims in the household.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims base on their gender.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid gender. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableEnum.name: gender
TunableEnum.description: The required gender of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: species
TunableVariant.description: Define a species condition for Sims in the household.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sim based on their species.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them with a valid species. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Define the required number of Sims required in order to satisfy the term.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: household_value
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their household value.
We intentionally do not conform Sims for this filter term. The only thing we have safe control over here is household funds, and this isn't player- facing, so it wouldn't be obvious if a Sim was conformed. A player will really only judge NPC wealth by property ownership and clothing.

TunableTuple.name: household_value
TunableTuple.description: An interval the Sim's household value must be between in order to conform to this filter term.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: in_club
TunableTuple.description: A term for filtering Sims based on if they are in a club or not.

Tunable.name: check_if_requesting_sim_can_join
Tunable.display: Check If Requesting Sim Can Join
Tunable.description: If checked then we will make sure that the requesting Sim can join one of the clubs of this Sim.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: in_compatible_region
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not be in the Same region, thus gating their availability to be in certain situations.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: in_family
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims living in the same household.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: in_same_club
TunableTuple.description: A term for filtering if the Sim and the requesting sim info are in the same club.

Tunable.name: check_supplied_club
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check if the Sim is in a specific supplied club. Check with your GPE before using this option because it will only work when the data is properly supplied by gameplay.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: is_busy
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that might be busy at the requested times, based on their work schedule.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: override
TunableVariant.description: Determine a set of Sims that is never considered busy.

TunableTuple.name: is_ghost
TunableTuple.description:
A filter term for filtering Sims that may or may not be ghosts.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: always_pass_active_household_sims
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will always pass sims in the active household, whether they are a ghost or not.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

Tunable.name: require_npc
Tunable.description: If enabled, the Sim needs to be an NPC. If not enabled, any Sim that is a ghost will pass the filter.

TunableTuple.name: is_hidden
TunableTuple.description: A filter term to filter out hidden sims.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: is_neighbor
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that are or are not neighbors. This is applicable even to neighbor Sims that have not met (thus not having relationship bits).
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: is_not_incestuous
TunableTuple.description: A filter term to filtering out sims that would be incestuous with the requesting sim info.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: is_roommate
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that are roommmates
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: target_household
TunableVariant.description: Which household must the sim be a roommate of.

TunableTuple.name: is_sim_sick
TunableTuple.description: A term for filtering Sims based on whether they are sick or not.

TunableVariant.name: difficulty_range
TunableVariant.description: Optionally define the difficulty rating range that is required for the Sim's sickness.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The difficulty rating range, this maps to 'difficulty_rating' values in Sickness tuning.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: lives_in_region
TunableTuple.description: A filter term for filtering if the Sims live in the specified region or not.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: region
TunableVariant.description: Which region to test against.

TunableVariant.name: street_for_creation
TunableVariant.description:
By default, Sims can only be created with this filter term if this term is inverted (that is, the resulting Sim is a townie that lives nowhere). Otherwise, the conform fails.
If this is enabled and the term is not inverted, the Sim will instead be assigned as townie living on the street.

TunableTuple.name: lives_on_apartment_floor
TunableTuple.description: A term for filtering Sims that live on the current apartment floor.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: lives_on_street
TunableTuple.description: A term for filtering Sims that live on the current street.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

TunableVariant.name: match_criteria
TunableVariant.description:
Criteria for a Sim to match this filter. This tunable is ignored if the filter is inverted. If inverted, the filter passes if the Sim doesn't live on the street and fails if so.
Match Target Population: If the number of townies living on the tuned street meets or exceeds the street's tuned townie threshold, then this filter term will be considered met.
Must Match: The Sim chosen or created must live on the street.

TunableTuple.name: match_target_population
TunableTuple.description: If the street is at its townie population cap, allow all Sims.

TunableTuple.name: must_match
TunableTuple.description: Sims must live on the street.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: The street the Sim must live on.

TunableTuple.name: lives_together
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims who are in the same travel group or household.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: consider_household
Tunable.description: If enabled, this will succeed if the Sim is in the same household as the requesting Sim.

Tunable.name: consider_travel_group
Tunable.description: If enabled, this will succeed if the Sim is in the same household as the requesting Sim.

Tunable.name: exclude_sims_in_both
Tunable.description: If enabled, this will fail if the Sim is in both the same household and travel group. If false, it doesn't care.

Tunable.name: include_roommates_as_household
Tunable.description: If enabled, roommates will be considered part of the same household.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: occult_ranked
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on ranked statistic.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by granting them occult type and XP to reach target rank.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableEnum.name: occult_type
TunableEnum.description: The occult type that this entry applies to.

TunableTuple.name: rank_values
TunableTuple.description: An interval of the Sim rank. Rank must be between the interval in order to pass the filter term. We set lower and upper rank interval so then Sim that is too weak or too strong will not pass the filter.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: perks
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not have perks.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by granting or removing the perks.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableList.name: perks
TunableList.description: List of perks that a Sim should has.

Tunable.description: The perks that Sim should has.

TunableTuple.name: pregnancy
TunableTuple.description: A term for filtering pregnant sims.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: pregnancy_partner_filter
TunableVariant.description: Specify how Sims are conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: Use_Spouse_or_Filter
Tunable.description: The filter that will be used to find a pregnancy partner for for this Sim.

TunableVariant.name: pregnancy_progress
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a specific

Tunable.name: ideal_value
Tunable.description: The ideal commodity value for scoring.

Tunable.name: maximum_value
Tunable.description: The maximum commodity value that will pass.

Tunable.name: minimum_value
Tunable.description: The minimum commodity value that will pass.

TunableTuple.name: ranked_statistic
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their ranked skills. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value of the ranked statistic.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by granting them ranked statistics, within the new bounds.
If you want to operate on the rank of the ranked statistic then make sure that the check box for 'use_rank' is checked. If you want this to behave more like a normal statistic using the "points" and not the rank then uncheck that value.

Tunable.name: ideal_value
Tunable.description: Ideal value of the ranked statistic that we are filtering against.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: max_value
Tunable.description: Maximum value of the ranked statistic that we are filtering against.

Tunable.name: min_value
Tunable.description: Minimum value of the ranked statistic that we are filtering against.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

Tunable.name: only_check_statistic_owned
Tunable.description: Only require that the statistic is actually owned by the sim, ignoring the statistic's level.

Tunable.name: ranked_statistic
Tunable.description: The ranked statistic the range applies to.

TunableVariant.name: score_spread_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled this interval modifies the spread over which the score should return.
A score is typically between 0 and 1. A score of 0 means the sim will never be selected, the higher a score is the more likely that sim is to be selected.
The score for statistic scoring is based on how close to the "ideal" value the value for the specified statistic for a sim is. It's a 1 if it's that exact score. It's *near* 0 (though not exactly, because the general idea behind this filter to make it a weight not elimination) as it gets farther from the ideal value and closer to the min or max value. (Note: it uses min_value -1 and max_value + 1 as the min/max values to avoid hitting 0. However the min/max values don't have to be accurate, so you can hit 0 by adjusting the tuned min/max values here as desired.)
So if you have it tuned as: min value: 0 max value: 5 ideal value: 5 The resulting score for each integer will be: 0 gives you: 0.17 1 gives you: 0.33 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
The minimum filter score tuning is simply a floor. Regardless of how low the calculated score is, if it's lower than the minimum filter score the result will simply be replaced with the minimum filter score.
So adding a minimum filter score of 0.5 simply results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.5 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
This optional tunable modifies the spread over which the score is returned (and gets rid of the -1/+1 padding as you can specify the padding in the actual range.) So instead of returning from 0 to 1, where 0 is as far away from the ideal as possible, and 1 is at the ideal value, it'll return the lower value when the statistic is as far away from the ideal value as possible, and the closer you get to the ideal value, the closer the return value will be to the maximum value.
So adding a score spread override of 0.5 to 1.0, (instead of a minimum filter score) results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.6 2 gives you: 0.7 3 gives you: 0.8 4 gives you: 0.9 5 gives you: 1
Note: Since, as stated, it's perfectly possible to lie about the min/max value, this result is also possible to achieve with clever tuning: min value of -4 max value of 5 ideal value of 5

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: use_rank
Tunable.description: If checked then use the rank value instead of the point value for our calculations.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_bit
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering against relationship bits.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by granting or removing the specified bits.

TunableList.name: black_list
TunableList.description: A set of relationship bits that requires the requesting sim to not have any one matching relationship bits with the sims we are scoring.

Tunable.description: A relationship bit that we will use to check if the requesting sim has it with the sim we are scoring.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: relationship_selector
TunableVariant.description: Define which relationships are to be considered.

TunableTuple.name: use_all_sims
TunableTuple.description: Consider the relationship with all known Sims.

TunableTuple.name: use_played_sims
TunableTuple.description: Consider the relationship with all known played Sims.

TunableTuple.name: use_requesting_sim
TunableTuple.description: Consider the relationship with the requesting Sim.

Tunable.name: requesting_sim_override
Tunable.description: If checked then the filter term will always return 1 if the requesting sim info is the sim info we are looking at.

Tunable.name: reverse_bit_lookup
Tunable.description: Look up the relationship bits for target to source sim, instead of the default behavior of source to target relationship bits

TunableList.name: white_list
TunableList.description: A set of relationship bits that requires the requesting sim to have at least one matching relationship bit with the sims we are scoring.

Tunable.description: A relationship bit that we will use to check if the requesting sim has it with the sim we are scoring. WARNING: If all elements are in a pack, then no sim will pass the filter if the pack(s) aren't installed.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_bit_collection
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering against relationship bits or bit collections.
This filter is NOT conformable

Tunable.name: only_check_statistic_owned

TunableVariant.name: score_spread_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled this interval modifies the spread over which the score should return.
A score is typically between 0 and 1. A score of 0 means the sim will never be selected, the higher a score is the more likely that sim is to be selected.
The score for statistic scoring is based on how close to the "ideal" value the value for the specified statistic for a sim is. It's a 1 if it's that exact score. It's *near* 0 (though not exactly, because the general idea behind this filter to make it a weight not elimination) as it gets farther from the ideal value and closer to the min or max value. (Note: it uses min_value -1 and max_value + 1 as the min/max values to avoid hitting 0. However the min/max values don't have to be accurate, so you can hit 0 by adjusting the tuned min/max values here as desired.)
So if you have it tuned as: min value: 0 max value: 5 ideal value: 5 The resulting score for each integer will be: 0 gives you: 0.17 1 gives you: 0.33 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
The minimum filter score tuning is simply a floor. Regardless of how low the calculated score is, if it's lower than the minimum filter score the result will simply be replaced with the minimum filter score.
So adding a minimum filter score of 0.5 simply results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.5 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
This optional tunable modifies the spread over which the score is returned (and gets rid of the -1/+1 padding as you can specify the padding in the actual range.) So instead of returning from 0 to 1, where 0 is as far away from the ideal as possible, and 1 is at the ideal value, it'll return the lower value when the statistic is as far away from the ideal value as possible, and the closer you get to the ideal value, the closer the return value will be to the maximum value.
So adding a score spread override of 0.5 to 1.0, (instead of a minimum filter score) results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.6 2 gives you: 0.7 3 gives you: 0.8 4 gives you: 0.9 5 gives you: 1
Note: Since, as stated, it's perfectly possible to lie about the min/max value, this result is also possible to achieve with clever tuning: min value of -4 max value of 5 ideal value of 5

TunableVariant.name: score_spread_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled this interval modifies the spread over which the score should return.
A score is typically between 0 and 1. A score of 0 means the sim will never be selected, the higher a score is the more likely that sim is to be selected.
The score for statistic scoring is based on how close to the "ideal" value the value for the specified statistic for a sim is. It's a 1 if it's that exact score. It's *near* 0 (though not exactly, because the general idea behind this filter to make it a weight not elimination) as it gets farther from the ideal value and closer to the min or max value. (Note: it uses min_value -1 and max_value + 1 as the min/max values to avoid hitting 0. However the min/max values don't have to be accurate, so you can hit 0 by adjusting the tuned min/max values here as desired.)
So if you have it tuned as: min value: 0 max value: 5 ideal value: 5 The resulting score for each integer will be: 0 gives you: 0.17 1 gives you: 0.33 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
The minimum filter score tuning is simply a floor. Regardless of how low the calculated score is, if it's lower than the minimum filter score the result will simply be replaced with the minimum filter score.
So adding a minimum filter score of 0.5 simply results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.5 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
This optional tunable modifies the spread over which the score is returned (and gets rid of the -1/+1 padding as you can specify the padding in the actual range.) So instead of returning from 0 to 1, where 0 is as far away from the ideal as possible, and 1 is at the ideal value, it'll return the lower value when the statistic is as far away from the ideal value as possible, and the closer you get to the ideal value, the closer the return value will be to the maximum value.
So adding a score spread override of 0.5 to 1.0, (instead of a minimum filter score) results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.6 2 gives you: 0.7 3 gives you: 0.8 4 gives you: 0.9 5 gives you: 1
Note: Since, as stated, it's perfectly possible to lie about the min/max value, this result is also possible to achieve with clever tuning: min value of -4 max value of 5 ideal value of 5

TunableTuple.name: trait
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on a trait they may or may not have.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by either granting or removing the specified trait.

Tunable.name: ignore_if_wrong_pack
Tunable.description: If checked then we will ignore this filter term if the specified trait isn't found. (.e.g. trait is from uninstalled pack.) For example we'd *like* to pick sims that use umbrellas. But if Seasons isn't installed it's ok to use sims that don't.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: The trait to filter against.

TunableTuple.name: university
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims going to university/in a specific Major.
To pass, Sims must have specified major as their current major and still be enrolled in at least one class.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

TunableVariant.name: major
TunableVariant.description: Which major(s) the sim must be pursuing.

TunableTuple.name: any_majors
TunableTuple.description: To pass, sim must currently be enrolled in any major.

Tunable.name: conform_using_skills
Tunable.description: If checked then when we conform a Sim using this filter term we will use the Sims skills to choose which Major to enroll them in. If unchecked we will pick one randomly.

TunableTuple.name: specific_majors
TunableTuple.description: To pass, the sim must currently be enrolled in 1 of the specified majors.

TunableList.name: _majors
TunableList.description: Sim must be currently enrolled in one of the specified majors.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: university
TunableVariant.description: University in which the sim must be enrolled. If Disabled, sim can be in any university.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The university to filter for.

TunableTuple.name: number_of_members
TunableTuple.description: The interval defines the range of number of members that need to fill in the situation job.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: organization
Tunable.description: The membership list of this organization fills in the situation's jobs.

Tunable.name: role
Tunable.description: The role state that the sim of this job starts the situation with.

Tunable.name: Member Situation Job
Tunable.description: A job created for this situation.

TunableTuple.name: non_member_job_and_role_states
TunableTuple.display: Non Member Job And Role States
TunableTuple.description:
The jobs and roles filled by sims outside of the organization.
Ensure the filters of these jobs include a filter term to exclude organization members.

TunableList.name: jobs_and_roles
TunableList.description: A mapping between a situation's jobs and default role states.

Tunable.name: number_of_sims_to_find
Tunable.description: The number of sims to find for this job.
